{"id":502376669,"lang":"rust","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1622719458,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/502376669/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Max Area of Island","memory":"2.2 MB","code":"use std::collections::VecDeque;\nuse std::collections::HashSet;\nuse std::cmp::max;\n\nimpl Solution {\n    pub fn max_area_of_island(grid: Vec<Vec<i32>>) -> i32 {\n        let mut queue: VecDeque<(i32, i32)> = VecDeque::with_capacity(2500);\n        let mut visited: HashSet<(i32, i32)> = HashSet::with_capacity(2500);\n        let (R, C) = (grid.len() as i32, grid[0].len() as i32);\n        let mut ans = 0;\n        \n        for r in 0..R {\n            for c in 0..C {\n                if grid[r as usize][c as usize] == 1 && !visited.contains(&(r, c)){\n                    queue.push_back((r, c));\n                    visited.insert((r, c));\n                    let mut tmp = 1;\n                    while 0 < queue.len() {\n                        let (y, x) = queue.pop_front().unwrap();\n                        let next_vec: Vec<(i32, i32)> = vec![(y+1, x), (y-1, x), (y, x+1), (y, x-1)];\n                        for (ny, nx) in next_vec.iter(){\n                            if 0 <= *ny && *ny < R && 0 <= *nx && *nx < C && grid[*ny as usize][*nx as usize] == 1 && !visited.contains(&(*ny, *nx)) {\n                                tmp += 1;\n                                visited.insert((*ny, *nx));\n                                queue.push_back((*ny, *nx))\n                            }\n                        }\n                    }\n                    ans = max(ans, tmp);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    return ans \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"max-area-of-island"}
